unnormalised: Someone asked me about what to expect in an ER in India. It's good to be prepared, esp. if you're unfamiliar with the system. First, triage is crucial. They'll quickly assess the severity of your condition. If it's a genuine emergency like a suspected heart attack (chest pain, etc.), or a major accident, you'll likely be seen ASAP. Expect questions about your symptoms, medical history, and any meds you're taking. They might ask about known allergies too.
normalised: Someone asked me about what to expect in an E-R in India. It's good to be prepared, especially if you're unfamiliar with the system. First, triage is crucial. They'll quickly assess the severity of your condition. If it's a genuine emergency like a suspected heart attack (chest pain, etcetera), or a major accident, you'll likely be seen A-S-A-P. Expect questions about your symptoms, medical history, and any medications you're taking. They might ask about known allergies too.

unnormalised: Next, remember, it's not always first-come, first-served. Patients are prioritized based on urgency. So someone with a minor cut might wait longer than someone with difficulty breathing. Expect tests - blood tests, ECG, X-rays, possibly even a CT scan depending on the situation. The docs, like Dr. Sharma from AIIMS (personal example!), will review results & determine the best course of action. Be patient, even if it’s frustrating.
normalised: Next, remember, it's not always first-come, first-served. Patients are prioritized based on urgency. So someone with a minor cut might wait longer than someone with difficulty breathing. Expect tests - blood tests, E-C-G, X-rays, possibly even a C-T scan depending on the situation. The doctors, like Doctor Sharma from A-I-I-M-S (personal example!), will review results and determine the best course of action. Be patient, even if it's frustrating.

unnormalised: Finally, costs vary significantly. A private hospital ER like Apollo could easily charge Rs. 5000 just for the initial consultation + basic tests. Govt. hospitals like CMC Vellore are cheaper, but might have longer wait times and be more crowded. Keep any insurance info handy. Also, prepone asking about costs upfront if possible. It’s best to know what to expect before you get a bill.
